entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 150,933Chapters: 31/53Kudos: 1,179

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham. Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave. The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running. Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother—the one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human. Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.

entry.title: bind the lamb, see not its teeth
entry.summary:
Author: Quill_writes

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,924Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 61

Summary: Jason of House Todd is a lord's bastard, shamed for the circumstances of his birth and what lies between his legs. The Gray Son of Gotham is a warlord, unceasing as a river's course, cutting a path across the continent with fury, flame, and the army at his back. The Gray Son's ire is fixed upon Jason's home, ready to burn all he holds dear. Lord Willis's knows that if he offers Jason as a lamb in silks - whore or wife - the favour of the Gray Son may be won. The cost to Jason's life and soul is of little consequence. The Gray Son’s eyebrow quirked, and his lips set with amusement. In the silence between them, Jason could not help but notice how handsome he was, like one of the southern wines which aged to perfection. Everything about him was intentional, the short, uneven crop of his hair, the carefully maintained beard. Gods above, he even smelled pleasant, leather and beeswax mingling with a rich musk. The Lord stepped back, Jason nearly collapsing from relief. Whatever the Gray Son was testing him for, he had passed. “I accept this gift,” the Gray Son said, unexpectedly. “Bathe him, and find some better clothes. Then bring him to my quarters.”

entry.title: the ghosts we leave behind
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,432Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 260

Summary: She had died in that suit. Bled in those colors. Burned for the symbol on her chest. And in less than six months Bruce had handed her place to someone else. Not another lost kid who knew the streets, who knew hunger and rage like she did. No. He’d chosen a boy. A boy with wealth, with schooling, with doors that had always been open to him. A boy who fit into Bruce’s world so easily, so seamlessly, while she had scraped and clawed for every scrap of approval. Everything she had never been good enough for—Tim Drake was, by default. The memory still cut. It always would. Because the Joker had lived. Because she had died. And because Bruce had moved on. Her lips curved into a smile, though there was nothing kind about it. “So you’re the one,” she said softly, bitterly. “My replacement.”Jane Todd came back to Gotham with a bang—or more accurately, the Joker’s head mounted on Arkham’s gates. It was only the beginning of the chaos she intended to bring.

entry.title: Dick bites. It's a problem.
entry.summary:
Author: VanyKruemelPendragon

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,326Chapters: 6/23Kudos: 152

Summary: Thanks to batsandbirdbrains (Tumblr) it's now my headcanon that Dick bit as Robin.This is a COLLECTION of oneshots, somewhat related around one thing: Dick bites.Mostly Mature for the biting and violence, though the last chapter is PWP (DickJay). “You bite strange men, you get the rinse,” Batman said. “That’s the rule.” Robin tried to twist away, but Batman levered Robin up onto his feet with one hand, the other aiming the peroxide at Robin’s mouth. Robin clamped his lips tight. Batman’s patience snapped. “Open,” he growled. “Now.”“Mh-mh!” Robin kicked, but Batman hoisted him higher, one hand under Robin’s armpit, the other holding his head in place.“You don’t want hepatitis.” Batman said, voice ticking up a notch.Robin stopped struggling, eyes wide. Batman saw the pause, and loosened his grip - only to make Robin wind out of his grip and start running. The man with the bitten arm moaned.“What the fuck is wrong with you?” he managed, voice thick with pain and shock.Robin deadlooped over him, baring his teeth in a wicked, blood-stained grin.“Don’t grab the Robin,” he said. “That’s the first lesson.” Fully written fic, upload every Wednesday and Sunday!

entry.title: My little Robin

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 113,328Chapters: 26/50Kudos: 207

entry.title: Blind Faith
entry.summary:
Author: AxisMage

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 177,733Chapters: 27/?Kudos: 174

Summary: It's no one's fault but his own that Dick is sitting there now, cold and utterly miserable, and very close to freezing to death.It's no one's fault but his own that he let his heart and mind get away again. It's no one's fault but his own that he wanted for someone who couldn't and wouldn't be his, and Wally is right.Dick needs to get back to his life, start over and make new friends. That's all, nothing more and nothing less. Friends, Dick needs friends, and sadly (according to Wally), Krypto isn't enough.

entry.title: What the Stork Brought
entry.summary:
Author: mynameisjessejk

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,755Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 121

Summary: Slade Wilson corrects what he sees as a grievous error of the universe, and still isn't allowed to keep a bird. Dick wasn't prepared to have a new brother today, but when the universe hands you one, you definitely don't give it back to the League of Assassins.
